articles.description: BBC Sport analyses why Pep Guardiola's possession-focused tactics have stopped working amid the rise in rapid, direct football.
articles.title: Man City: Why Pep Guardiola's tactics stopped working amid rise of rapid football

articles.description: Russian Dmitry Bivol produces a masterclass to gain revenge over compatriot Artur Beterbiev and win the undisputed light-heavyweight world title.
articles.title: Beterbiev vs Bivol 2: Dmitry Bivol majority decision points win over Artur Beterbiev

articles.description: England's grinding win over Scotland opens up a route to a potentially glittering prize.
articles.title: Six Nations: England move into title mix with win over Scotland

articles.description: How a cricketer born in Yorkshire and brought up supporting Coventry City put England in a spin.
articles.title: Champions Trophy: Josh Inglis gives England the blues by powering Australia to victory

articles.description: The Premier League title race may not be done yet - but Mikel Arteta was "very, very angry" after Arsenal's loss to West Ham.
articles.title: 'I'm very, very angry' - Mikel Arteta says Arsenal title hopes 'not in our hands'

articles.description: BBC Scotland's chief sports writer Tom English assesses how Scotland's 'inability to be completely ruthless' cost them at Twickenham.
articles.title: Six Nations 2025: 'Opportunities missed will haunt Scotland on rough day'

articles.description: Marcus Rashford inspires Aston Villa to a comeback victory over Chelsea, providing assists for both of Marco Asensio's goals.
articles.title: Aston Villa 2-1 Chelsea: Marcus Rashford 'new hero' and inspires Villa comeback win

articles.description: Jenni Hermoso hopes an "important precedent" has been set after Luis Rubiales' conviction for kissing the Spain striker without her consent during 2023 World Cup medal ceremony.
articles.title: Jenni Hermoso hopes Luis Rubiales conviction sets 'important precedent'

articles.description: Manager Philippe Clement says he is "busy finding solutions" rather than worrying about whether his Rangers future has been cast into further doubt by another humbling Ibrox defeat.
articles.title: Rangers 0-2 St Mirren: Philippe Clement 'busy finding solutions' after another loss

articles.description: Hamzah Sheeraz's world title challenge ended in disappointment but the Briton was fortunate to claim draw against WBC middleweight champion Carlos Adames in Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: Beterbiev vs Bivol 2: Briton Hamzah Sheeraz bout with Carlos Adames ends in controversial draw
